episode: A few months ago, I played in a tournament for my favorite video game of all time.  My team performed worse than expected and I mainly blamed myself for being rusty and not practicing as much as I should have.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I'm still pretty disappointed in my performance in that tournament.  I feel like I let my team down.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Don't be too hard on yourself, it's just one game.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Actually it was more than one game, it was several over the course of a few months.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That can be tough to bounce back from, what specifically is bothering you about your performance?

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I just know I didn't live up to my own expectations.  I used to be a top player but I stopped playing for a few years so I was really rusty for the whole tournament.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's tough to get back into the swing of things after a break, but you're recognizing the rust, that's a start to improving.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah I guess.  Unfortunately the game kind of died off again so it will be awhile before I have another chance to redeem myself.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Bummer, but maybe the break will give you time to practice and come back even stronger next time.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: That's true.  I don't really have the motivation anymore though.  My priorities have changed in life and playing games competitively isn't as important to me anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Life gets in the way, priorities shift, it's okay to move on.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah.  It's tough though.  I was obsessed with the game for years and it was kind of a big part of my identity.  I still love it but I rarely get around to playing anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's hard to let go of something that was such a big part of you for so long.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah.  That's why it would have been nice to prove I still had my skills like I used to.  I'm sure I could get it back but the motivation just isn't there.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's like you're saying goodbye to a part of yourself, but it's okay to acknowledge it's not the same anymore.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Exactly.  It's such a unique game too.  It actually feels like a sport when you're playing it.  There's really nothing else like it.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's special, it's not every game that can give you that kind of experience.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Also the community.  I got to know a lot of different people from all over the world and had some unforgettable moments.  Even though it was just a game it felt special.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's amazing how games can bring people together like that, creating lifelong memories and connections.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Yeah.  Like some people I've known for close to 10 years.  Others have been playing together even longer than that.  It was a very close knit community.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's incredible, 10 years is a long time, it's like a second family.
